item.title: Cecily Strong | Obama Campaigns Against Kari Lake and Warns About Threats to Democracy: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republican candidates who are in very close races and could easily win in the midterms, including the pro-Trump election deniers who have outright declared they will use their power to steal future elections.

Then, Cecily Strong talks about seeing bears when she was in Canada for Schmigadoon!, going snorkeling in the Mediterranean Sea and her impression of Kari Lake on Saturday Night Live.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe & Weird Al Yankovic | Graham Ordered to Testify in Georgia; Lindell Says He's Monitoring Midterms: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Supreme Court ordering Sen. Lindsey Graham to testify in front of a grand jury for the investigation into Trump's attempt to steal votes before speaking with Daniel Radcliffe, Weird Al Yankovic and Kerry Condon and welcoming musical guest Kurt Vile & The Violators.

Then, Daniel Radcliffe and Weird Al Yankovic talk about the creation of Weird: The Al Yankovic Story, hilarious cameos from Akiva Schaffer and Jorma Taccone in the film and Weird Al's parodies boosting the sales of original songs.


See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: John Irving | Republicans Are Already Claiming the Midterms Are Rigged Unless They Win: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republicans continuing to spread conspiracy theories about the 2020 election, intimidating people trying to vote and preemptively claiming that the results must be illegitimate if they lose the midterm elections.

Then, author John Irving talks about writing his longest book The Last Chairlift, addressing sexual and gender politics in his novels and writing his 1985 book The Cider House Rules, as a warning of what could happen if abortions were illegal.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Sharon Horgan | Dramatic Jan. 6 Hearing Issues Trump Subpoena, Hints at Criminal Referrals: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the January 6 committee voting to subpoena Trump while also hinting at possible criminal referrals for key figures involved in the coup and revealing new evidence from the Secret Service corroborating key details about the insurrection.

Then, Sharon Horgan talks about meeting Pierce Brosnan right before her interview, writing, producing and starring in the series Bad Sisters and her daughters' honest criticism of her work.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Brendan Gleeson & Colin Farrell | DOJ Says Trump Still Has More Stolen Docs, Tells SCOTUS to Stay Out of Case: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Justice Department's response to Trump's attempt to get the Supreme Court to intervene in the investigation of his stolen classified documents, while Republicans continue to support him and his hand-picked candidates like Herschel Walker.

Then, Brendan Gleeson and Colin Farrell talk about their experience hosting SNL, working with Martin McDonagh 14 years after In Bruges for their film The Banshees of Inisherin and Farrell's run-in with the animals in the film.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Vice President Kamala Harris | Trump Accidentally Confesses in Stolen Docs Case; Biden's Marijuana Pardons: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer at Republicans fully embracing Trump even as the federal criminal investigation into his stolen classified documents intensifies and Biden taking the first steps towards decriminalizing marijuana.

Then, in her first in-studio late night appearance since taking office, Vice President Kamala Harris discusses the next steps for pardoning marijuana possession, explains how American lives can change if Democrats have the majority in the Senate and urges people to vote in the upcoming midterm elections.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Fred Armisen, Ana Fabrega and Julio Torres | GOP Reels as Scandal-Ridden MAGA Candidates like Walker and Oz Implode: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the GOP rallying behind several pro-Trump Senate candidates whose campaigns have been engulfed in scandal as Trump himself continues to face more legal scrutiny over the stolen classified documents he stashed away at Mar-a-Lago.

Then, Fred Armisen, Ana Fabrega and Julio Torres share how they would describe their show Los Espookys, explain the differences between Seasons 1 and 2 and express their hatred for CGI butterflies.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Sarah Sherman | Trump Takes Classified Docs Case to SCOTUS; Rudy’s Gross Toilet Habits: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump appealing a ruling in his stolen classified documents case directly to the Supreme Court, including Justice Clarence Thomas, whose wife has been directly implicated in Trump's attempted coup, posing a major test to the strength of our constitutional system.

Then, Sarah Sherman talks about doing stand-up after her first year on Saturday Night Live, specializing in body-horror comedy and her iconic meatball sketch with Oscar Isaac.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Ramy Youssef | GOP Stumbles Toward Midterms as Trump Claims All Elections Are Rigged: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump making it difficult for Republicans to pretend they have a serious governing philosophy by claiming all elections are rigged and launching a deranged attack on Mitch McConnell and his wife.

Then, Ramy Youssef talks about what to expect from Season 3 of Ramy, his distrust of the United States government and what his parents think of the show.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Hua Hsu | Elissa Bassist
item.description:
This month on Late Night Lit, Late Night supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly talks to Hua Hsu, a New Yorker editor whose new book Stay True: A Memoir explores friendship, grief, the search for self, and the solace that can be found through art.

Then, she talks to Elissa Bassist, author of the very funny and poignant Hysterical: A Memoir.

Finally, Chelsea Clinton offers a book recommendation backstage at Studio 8G during her recent appearance on Late Night.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Rachel Sennott | Jan. 6 Panel Grills Ginni Thomas About Shocking Coup Texts with Trump Team: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the January 6 committee deposing Ginni Thomas, the spouse of a sitting Supreme Court justice, and more video evidence emerging of another Trump ally, Roger Stone, discussing plans before the election to declare victory and overturn the results if Trump lost.

Then, Rachel Sennott tells Seth a story she’s been saving for years, asks Seth an important question about his interns and explains why she had to clean up her Twitter.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Nick Kroll | Jan. 6 Committee Obtains Damning Roger Stone Video, Weighs Trump Subpoena: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at damning new documentary footage of key Trump ally Roger Stone discussing plans for a violent coup to overturn the 2020 election and the January 6 committee debating some of its biggest unanswered questions including whether to subpoena Mike Pence or Trump himself.

Then, Nick Kroll talks about his son asking for high-fives from strangers and using his parents as material for his comedy.

item.title: Sen. Bernie Sanders | Biden Responds to Putin's Latest Nuke Threat; Trump's Bizarre Nuke Rant: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Vladimir Putin once again threatening the world with nuclear weapons in Russia’s brutal war against Ukraine, which prompted Donald Trump to say something totally insane and incoherent.

Then, Senator Bernie Sanders talks about the limits of the Inflation Reduction Act, the stark contrast between rising consumer prices and rising corporate profits and student loan forgiveness.

item.title: Alan Cumming | Trump Unravels on Fox News, Claims He Can Declassify Docs with His Mind: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump fully disintegrating into an incoherent mess and claiming he can declassify documents by simply declaring them declassified inside his mind during an interview with Fox News.

Then, Alan Cumming talks about constantly being in pain from putting on his one-man show Burn, bowing incorrectly in front of Prince Charles and trying to catch a lift with Queen Elizabeth while he was a boy scout.

item.title: Billy Eichner | NY AG’s Bombshell Lawsuit Accuses Trump of Staggering Fraud, Seeks $250M: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at New York Attorney General Letitia James suing Trump over allegations of staggering fraud and a special master chastising Trump's legal team during a hearing on the classified Mar-a-Lago documents.

Then, Billy Eichner talks about doing Billy on the Street with Paul Rudd for the first time in three years, filming Bros on a controlled set in New York City and his half brother having to watch his sex scenes in the film.

item.title: Hillary Clinton & Chelsea Clinton | Mark Meadows Complies with DOJ Subpoena; Brett Favre Scandal Texts Revealed: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Mark Meadows complying with the Justice Department's subpoena, making him the highest-ranking Trump official so far to respond to a federal subpoena in the criminal investigation of the attempted coup on January 6.

Then, Hillary Clinton and Chelsea Clinton talk about how traveling has changed for them since leaving the White House, what it was like to go to clown school for their docuseries Gutsy and hanging out with Amber Ruffin.

Hillary Clinton and Chelsea Clinton also discuss how the overturning of Roe v. Wade might impact future elections, the major issues behind Trump's classified documents scandal and Chelsea's children's book, Welcome to the Big Kids Club.

item.title: Michael Che | Leila Mottley | Top Pence Aide Warned Secret Service That Trump Would Turn on Pence: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Mike Pence's former chief of staff warning the Secret Service that Trump may put Pence's physical safety at risk before the attempted coup on January 6.

Then, Michael Che talks about using his downtime from Saturday Night Live to film his sketch show That Damn Michael Che, having an intervention with his ex-girlfriends in Season 2 of the series and how he spends his free time.

After that, author Leila Mottley talks about the release of her debut novel, her dad Nick Mottley having a word of the week to fit new vocabulary words into every sentence and the story behind her book Nightcrawling. She continues the conversation backstage with Late Night's Sarah Jenks-Daly, where she discusses being recognized by Oprah's Book Club.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Seth Meyers On "I'm Not Scared, You're Scared"

item.title: Ricky Gervais | Senate GOP Blocks Election Bill, Manchin and Sinema Vote to Keep Filibuster: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Senators Joe Manchin and Kyrsten Sinema voting with Republicans in blocking changes to the filibuster that would have allowed voting rights legislation to pass with a simple majority.

Then, Ricky Gervais talks about his show After Life, the show's heavy subject matter and his writing process. He also shares an update on his health, comments on the Hollywood Foreign Press’ Golden Globes Awards and talks about his return to stand-up.

item.title: Amy Adams | Fox News Poll Contradicts Fox News Talking Points on Vaccine Mandates: A Closer Look

Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump reportedly believing he'll be "reinstated" in the White House as some of his allies and supporters openly call for a coup.

Then, Quinta Brunson teases her new book She Memes Well, explains the origin of her name and reveals why she walked out of an early gig.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Kaitlyn Greenidge | Kenya Hunt
item.description:
On today's episode of our books podcast, Late Night's Sarah Jenks-Daly speaks with Kaitlyn Greenidge, author of Liberty.

She also talks to Kenya Hunt, deputy editor of Grazia UK and the author of Girl Gurl Grrrl: On Womanhood and Belonging in the Age of Black Girl Magic. Be sure to check out her project www.roommentoring.com.

item.title: Edward-Isaac Dovere | Arizona Republicans Push Forward with Insane 2020 Election "Audit": A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republicans pushing forward with an insane so-called audit of Arizona's election results and their plans to pursue similar audits in other states that Joe Biden won.

Then, Edward-Isaac Dovere talks about covering the 2020 election in his book Battle for the Soul, his conversation with Biden after the inauguration and how the Democratic Party compares to Star Wars.

item.description:

item.title: Late Night Lit: Gayle Tzemach Lemmon & Brandon Hobson
item.description:
On today's episode of Late Night Lit, Late Night supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly speaks with New York Times bestselling author Gayle Tzemach Lemmon, author of the new book Daughters Of Kobani.

She also speaks with National Book Award finalist Brandon Hobson, author of the new novel The Removed.

Then, some members of the Late Night with Seth Meyers staff share book recommendations.


Mentioned in this episode:

Daughters Of Kobani by Gayle Tzemach Lemmon

"How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days"

"10 Things I Hate About You"

"World War Z"

Our Women on the Ground: Essays by Arab Women Reporting from the Arab World edited by Zahra Hankir

The House at Sugar Beach: In Search of a Lost African Childhood by Helene Cooper

Reading Lolita in Tehran by Azar Nafisi

The Removed by Brandon Hobson

Crooked Hallelujah by Kelli Jo Ford

Winter Counts by David Heska Wanbli Weiden

Remain in Love by Chris Frantz

The Overstory by Richard Powers




See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

Then, Chelsea Handler talks about living by herself in Canada, her cleaning lady’s very intimate relationship with her dogs and why she’s no longer crushing on New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Seth Meyers & 2020 Literary Reflections
item.description:
To end 2020, Late Night Lit concluded that only one guest would be suitable to reflect on the year in books and how literature has nourished us during the pandemic. Luckily, Seth Meyers said yes. Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly talks to Seth about the role of authors on Late Night. Plus, they pay tribute to one of Seth's favorite authors, the late John le Carré.

Then, she talks to Late Night researchers Matt Reimann and Kat Spillane, who help out with all things related to literature on the show. They discuss what they've caught up on in 2020.


Mentioned in this episode:

Yaa Gyasi (who appeared on Late Night for "Transcendent Kingdom" and "Homegoing")

"A Brief History of Seven Killings" by Marlon James

"The Goldfinch" by Donna Tartt

"Blacktop Wasteland" by S.A. Cosby

"Mirror & The Light" by Hilary Mantel

"Monogamy" by Sue Miller

"The Vanishing Half" by Brit Bennett

"Sea Wife" by Amity Gaige

"Writers & Lovers" by Lily King

"Missionaries" by Phil Klay

"The Night Manager" by John le Carré

"Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy" by John le Carré

"Slough House" by Mick Herron

Ta-Nehisi Coates (who has appeared many times on Late Night)

"The Sympathizer" by Viet Thanh Nguyen

George Saunders (who appeared on Late Night for "Lincoln in the Bardo")

Helen Oyeyemi (who appeared on Late Night for "What Is Not")

"Democracy in America" by Alexis de Tocqueville

"The Labyrinth of Solitude" by Octavio Paz

"The Theory of Moral Sentiments" by Adam Smith

"Emma" by Jane Austen

"Sense and Sensibility" by Jane Austen

"Persuasion" by Jane Austen

"Harry Potter" series by J.K. Rowling

"Moby-Dick" by Herman Melville 

"Pachinko" by Min Jin Lee

"Memorial" by Bryan Washington

"Motherhood" by Sheila Heti

“Slaughterhouse-Five” by Kurt Vonnegut

Kurt Vonnegut's letter to his daughter Nanette (referenced on Gaslit Nation)

"Fake Accounts” by Lauren Oyler 

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Jimmy Fallon | Amber Ruffin's 2020 Christmas Song
item.description:
Late Night writer Amber Ruffin performs a special Christmas song in an attempt to cheer up those who won't be able to make it home for the holidays.

Then, Jimmy Fallon talks about The Tonight Show adjusting to the limitations of the coronavirus pandemic, reinventing pajamas and his fourth book 5 More Sleeps ‘til Christmas.

item.title: Mehdi Hasan | Trump Threatens Not to Leave White House on Inauguration Day: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the president and his enablers continuing their attempt to end democracy just a month ahead of the end of the Trump administration.

Mehdi Hasan talks about launching The Mehdi Hasan Show on Peacock from home during the coronavirus pandemic, calls for Trump to be held accountable for his attempt to steal the election and explains why the right-wing media is a "safe space" in its own right.

item.title: Stacey Abrams | Trump's Mar-a-Lago Neighbors Don't Want Him to Move There: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Republican Party and right-wing media still insisting there’s a way for Trump to subvert the will of the voters and remain in office.

Then, Stacey Abrams discusses preparing for the upcoming Georgia Senate runoffs, expresses her concerns for Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue's support of Trump's false voter fraud claims and shares her expectations for voter suppression efforts in Georgia.

item.title: The Chicks | Electoral College Formalizes Biden’s Win, Trump’s Loss: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump and the Republican Party desperately attempting to dismantle our democracy, even after the Electoral College voted to make Joe Biden the next president of the United States.

Then, the band The Chicks (Natalie Maines, Emily Strayer, Martie Maguire) wage their bets on who could drink Seth under the table, talk about their new album "Gaslighter" and reveal how close their sleuthing fans get while trying to decipher their lyrics.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Aubrey Plaza | Trump and Texas File New Election Lawsuit After Supreme Court Rejection: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Supreme Court rejecting a lawsuit seeking to block Pennsylvania from certifying its electoral votes for Joe Biden and the GOP attempting another Hail Mary pass to overturn the election results.

item.title: Journalist Adam Davidson
item.description:
Late Night writer Dina Gusovsky interrupts Seth to explain why she’s jealous of Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

Then, finance journalist Adam Davidson discusses how the world might change under the Biden administration, explains how Trump is a "bottom feeder" on corruption that already existed in the world and breaks down why Ivanka is the toughest Trump.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Deesha Philyaw & Todd Doughty
item.description:
On today's episode of Late Night Lit, Late Night supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly speaks with Deesha Philyaw, author of the new novel "The Secret Lives of Church Ladies."

Then, she speaks with Todd Doughty, senior v-p and deputy publisher at Doubleday.

Plus, hear some book recommendations from members of the Late Night staff.


Mentioned in this episode:

"The Secret Lives of Church Ladies" by Deesha Philyaw

"The Prophets" by Robert Jones, Jr.

"Milk Blood Heat" by Dantiel W. Moniz

"A Little Life" by Hanya Yanagihara

"The Testaments" by Margaret Atwood

"Family of Origin" by CJ Hauser

Todd Doughty's Instagram

"Little Pieces of Hope" by Todd Doughty

"The Pelican Brief" by John Grisham

"Still Life: A Chief Inspector Gamache Novel" by Louise Penny

"Bath Haus" by P.J. Vernon

"Charlotte's Web" by E.B. White

"The Years of Lyndon Johnson" by Robert Caro

"The End of October" by Lawrence Wright

"The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle" by Haruki Murakami

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Susie Yang & Erin Geiger Smith
item.description:
On today's episode of Late Night Lit, Late Night supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly speaks with Susie Yang, author of the new novel "White Ivy."

Then, she speaks with Erin Geiger Smith, author of "Thank You for Voting: The Maddening, Enlightening, Inspiring Truth About Voting in America."

Plus, hear some book recommendations from members of the Late Night staff.


Mentioned in this episode:

"White Ivy" by Susie Yang

"The Count of Monte Cristo" by Alexandre Dumas

"The Lying Life of Adults" and the "My Brilliant Friend" series by Elena Ferrante

"Patrick Melrose" by Edward St Aubyn

"Thank You for Voting: The Maddening, Enlightening, Inspiring Truth About Voting in America" and "Thank You for Voting Young Readers' Edition" by Erin Geiger Smith

"The Vanishing Half" by Brit Bennett

"Luster" by Raven Leilani

"Utopia Avenue" by David Mitchell

"What Remains: A Memoir of Fate, Friendship and Love" by Carole Radziwill

"Someone Who Will Love You in All Your Damaged Glory" by Raphael Bob-Waksberg

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Late Night Political Party, Part 1
item.description:
This is the first part of our three-part series Late Night Political Party, in which Late Night with Seth Meyers staffers reflect on what it's like to work on a comedy show in a truly unprecedented time in American politics.

In this episode, supervising producer Henry Melcher talks to the members of the show's guest research department, comprised of Kat Spillane, Matt Reimann and Elisabeth Roberts. They discuss what goes into preparing Seth Meyers for his interviews with politicians and other political guests.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Meena Harris & Karen Russell
item.description:
On today's episode of Late Night Lit, Late Night supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly speaks with Meena Harris, an entrepreneur, lawyer, founder of the Phenomenal Woman Action Campaign and author of "Kamala and Maya’s Big Idea," a children's book about her aunt Kamala Harris and her mother Maya Harris.

Then, she speaks with Karen Russell, a Pulitzer finalist and author of the novella "Sleep Donation." 

Plus, hear some book recommendations from members of the Late Night staff.


Mentioned in this episode:

"Phenomenal Woman" by Maya Angelou

"Kamala and Maya’s Big Idea" by Meena Harris

"Hair Love" by Matthew Cherry

Author Mac Barnett

"Sleep Donation" by Karen Russell

"One Hundred Years of Solitude" by Gabriel García Márquez

Author Italo Calvino

"In the Land of Good Living: A Journey to the Heart of Florida" by Kent Russell

"Dance on Saturday: Stories" by Elwin Cotman

"I Hold a Wolf by the Ears" by Laura van den Berg

"I Know Everything" by Matthew Farrell

"The Man Who Invented Rock Hudson: The Pretty Boys and Dirty Deals of Henry Willson" by Robert Hofler

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Late Night Lit: Colson Whitehead & Danielle Mullen
item.description:
On this first episode of Late Night Lit, Late Night's new literary podcast, supervising producer Sarah Jenks-Daly talks to two-time Pulitzer winning author Colson Whitehead.

She also speaks with Danielle Mullen, founder of Semicolon, the only black female owned bookstore in Chicago.

Plus, hear some book recommendations from members of the Late Night staff.


Books mentioned in this episode:

"The Nickel Boys" by Colson Whitehead

"Zone One" by Colson Whitehead

"The Underground Railroad" by Colson Whitehead

"The City We Became" by N.K. Jemisin

"Such a Fun Age" by Kiley Reid

"The Vanishing Half" by Brit Bennett

"Luster" by Raven Leilani

"How Much of These Hills is Gold" by C. Pam Zhang

"Dance Dance Dance" by Haruki Murakami

"Talking to Strangers" by Malcolm Gladwell

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Iowa Special Episode, Part 2: The Aftermath
item.description:
In part two of our special series about the Iowa caucuses, Late Night supervising producer Henry Melcher follows up with a few people he spoke to while in Des Moines to understand how Iowans felt about the election fiasco on Monday, resulting in a vote whose results are delayed — if they ever come out at all.

He also conducts some interviews to learn more about the activism and organization that helps mobilize people of color during Iowa elections.

item.title: Rep. Adam Schiff | Senate Republicans Say They Won’t Hold a Fair Impeachment Trial: A Closer Look
item.description:

Representative Adam Schiff talks about his rise in recognizability, Trump’s quid pro quo and the behavior of his Republican colleagues. 

Then, Late Night supervising producer Henry Melcher and A Closer Look supervising writer Sal Gentile ask Rep. Schiff a few more questions about his role in the impeachment inquiry.

item.title: Sen. Kamala Harris | Rudy Giuliani Butt-Dials Reporter; Trump Booed at World Series: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump getting booed at the World Series a few days after his lawyer butt-dialed a reporter.

Then, Senator Kamala Harris talks about the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the impeachment inquiry into President Trump and Rudy Giuliani’s ability as a lawyer. Plus, she talks about getting caught by a reporter talking about moving to Iowa and reacts to Maya Rudolph playing her on SNL.

After that, she took a few more questions with Late Night's Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G exclusively for this podcast.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

After that, John takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night's Henry Melcher.

Then, Ocean Vuong talks about writing his book in his closet, basing his fictional characters on his own experience and his mother’s response to his novel.

He also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Beanie Feldstein | The Kind of Story We Need Right Now
item.description:
Seth steps away from bleak and depressing news to share a news story about a Connecticut man fighting a traffic ticket for talking on his cell phone while driving by proving it wasn’t a phone - it was a hash brown.

Then, Beanie Feldstein talks about Booksmart, describes the film's parallels to Superbad and tells the story of when she first met Olivia Wilde.

She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Jason Mantzoukas | Trump Fights with China, Rudy Seeks Ukraine’s Help in 2020: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the president meeting with the leader of Hungary and feuding with China while his lawyer was trying to get Ukraine to meddle in the 2020 election.

item.title: Kit Harington | Mark Hamill | Jokes Seth Can't Tell
item.description:
There are some jokes that just sound wrong coming from Seth, like the one about Esquire magazine featuring a profile on the hardships of growing up white, middle class and male.

Then, Kit Harington talks about his recent stint hosting SNL, pranking his wife on April Fools' Day and resisting the urge to spoil the ending of Game of Thrones for himself.

After that, Mark Hamill talks about falling into his character in Knightfall, trolling Star Wars fans and the differences between screen acting and voice acting.

item.title: Live At SXSW: Late Night Trash Can With Amber Ruffin & Jenny Hagel
item.description:
When you write for a late night television show, you pitch a lot of ideas - and a lot of them get rejected. But in Late Night Trash Can, they get resurrected! "Late Night with Seth Meyers" writers Amber Ruffin and Jenny Hagel read jokes, sketches and desk pieces that they have pitched during their years at Late Night that didn't make it to the show. And they share the stories about why the pieces were rejected - and what they learned from it.

Recorded live in Austin, Texas at South by Southwest on March 10, 2019.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.description:
Seth takes a break from breaking news to check in on the skyrocketing costs of prescription drugs, which President Trump claimed he would be able to fix.

Then, SNL's Heidi Gardner talks about working with Will Forte on Alien News Desk, bringing characters to life on Weekend Update and her life before SNL. She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

Also: Don't miss Amber Ruffin and Jenny Hagel live in Austin at SXSW.

item.title: Five Year Anniversary Podcast
item.description:
On February 24, 2014, Seth Meyers officially took over as the host of "Late Night" on NBC. On this special edition of the Late Night Podcast, Seth sits down with members of his staff and crew to look back on the first five years.

In this episode, Seth speaks with Fred Armisen (01:02), Amber Ruffin (03:57), Alex Baze (09:04), Eric Leiderman (14:23), Haleigh Raff (19:24), Gene Kelly (24:51), Sal Gentile (28:52), Alex Vietmeier (33:19), Hillary Hunn (37:43), Jeremiah Silva (42:16), Kenny Coyle & Ryan Fox (47:31) and Wally Feresten (52:32).

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Stacey Abrams | Did Manafort Lie to Mueller to Protect Trump?: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump insisting the Russia investigation has found nothing even after his ex-campaign chairman lied to the FBI.

Then, Stacey Abrams talks about delivering the 2019 Democratic response to Trump's State of the Union and what she thinks should happen next if Trump declares a national emergency.

She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Jake Johnson | Trump Attacks the 2020 Democrats: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump attacking Democrats running for president and those investigating him in Congress.

Then, Jake Johnson tells Seth a story about his disastrous encounter with Steve Harvey on his daytime talk show. He also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Marlon James | Claire Adam | Trump and Phil Robertson Freak Out About "Socialism": A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump freaking out about the Democrats running for president.

Then, Seth talks to author Marlon James about how winning the Man Booker Prize changed his life, planning out the trilogy of Black Leopard, Red Wolf and asking George R.R. Martin to write a blurb for his book. Marlon also takes a few more questions backstage just for this podcast.

Then, author Claire Adam talks to Seth about growing up in Trinidad, not letting her family read her novel, Golden Child, until it was finished and her writing process. She takes a few more questions backstage as well.


FOLLOW LATE NIGHT WITH SETH MEYERS

item.title: Jake Tapper | Trump's 2019 State of the Union Address: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's 2019 State of the Union address in which he attacked the investigations of his presidency and repeated his demand for a border wall.

Then. Seth talks to CNN's Jake Tapper, who also takes a few more questions backstage exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Nicolle Wallace | Howard Schultz and Cliff Sims Stumble in Interviews: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump facing an independent challenge from the former CEO of Starbucks and a tell-all book from a former aide.

Then, Nicolle Wallace speculates on how the Trump administration is preparing for the State of the Union, and she talks about Nancy Pelosi's legislative acumen and what Senator Kamala Harris has that scares Trump.

After that, Wallace takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Claire McCaskill | Sherrod Brown | Roger Stone Indicted as Trump Caves on Shutdown: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump caving on the signature promise of his campaign and one of his closest advisers getting indicted in the Russia investigation.

Then, Seth talks to former senator Claire McCaskill about being the first senator to join Twitter, her thoughts on whether the Democratic Party should move toward more moderate or progressive politics and the connection between Alex Trebek and her student loans. (10:33) She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G. (18:19)

After that, Senator Sherrod Brown talks about speaking with President Trump about policy, the ongoing government shutdown and why he thinks the mood of the country is optimistic. (26:21) He also takes a few more additional questions exclusively for this podcast. (36:48)


FOLLOW LATE NIGHT WITH SETH MEYERS

item.title: Colin Jost & Michael Che | Trump's Shutdown Is Making America Less Safe: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is still holding the government hostage over his demand for a border wall as federal employees prepare to go another week without pay.

Then, he talks to Saturday Night Live's Colin Jost and Michael Che, who also take a few more questions backstage. Their bonus segment begins at 23:50.

item.description:

Then, Amber Ruffin says "what" about the Gillette commercial, the Covington Catholic High kids and more.

item.title: Chris Hayes | Trump and the Shutdown: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the continuing government shutdown and President Trump announcing a primetime address to repeat his lies. (This was broadcast prior to Trump's address.)

Then, MSNBC's Chris Hayes describes some of the inspiring scenes from the swearing in of the 116th Congress and talks about impeaching Trump.

After that, Chris walks from Studio 8G to the All In studio in 30 Rock while chatting with Late Night producer Henry Melcher.

item.title: Rachel Brosnahan | Trump Threatens a Government Shutdown over His Wall: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump threatening a government shutdown over funding for his border wall just as he faces the most serious legal peril of his presidency.

Then, Rachel Brosnahan talks about Cecily Strong's impersonation of her on SNL and filming scenes for The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel in Paris.

After that, Brosnahan reveals the truth about her birthday backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Bill Burr | Stephen Miller and Rudy Giuliani Try to Defend Trump: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump's friends and aides have abandoned him, leaving only Stephen Miller and Rudy Giuliani to defend him.

Bill Burr talks about his animated show F is for Family, environmentally sound parenting and shares his complex feelings on religion. Plus, what it's like to perform stand-up abroad and the conspiracy theory that drove him to pursue his helicopter license.

Burr also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G just for this podcast.

item.title: Kate Bosworth | Trump Speaks Out After Cohen Sentencing: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's interview in which he desperately tried to rebut allegations that he broke campaign finance laws.

Then, Kate Bosworth talks about tackling the subject of human trafficking in the film Nona and shares the story about the tattoo her husband got for her three weeks into dating.

After that, she takes a few more questions from backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Jahana Hayes | Prosecutors Say Donald Trump Committed a Crime: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Justice Department effectively calling the President of the United States a criminal and Trump announcing the departure of his chief of staff.

Representative-elect Jahana Hayes talks about what pushed her to run for office, what orientation in Congress is like and her first impressions of the inefficiencies on Capitol Hill.

After that, Hayes stuck around to answer a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Mehdi Hasan | Trump's Witness Tampering; Wisconsin GOP's Power Grab: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the how Donald Trump along with Republicans in Michigan and Wisconsin pose a threat to democracy.

Then, journalist Mehdi Hasan talks about his unique advantage in interviewing Trump's proxies and the main difference between the British and American press.

After that, Hasan takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Henry Melcher.

item.content:encoded:
Seth takes a closer look at the how Donald Trump along with Republicans in Michigan and Wisconsin pose a threat to democracy.

Then, journalist Mehdi Hasan talks about his unique advantage in interviewing Trump's proxies and the main difference between the British and American press.

After that, Hasan takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Henry Melcher.

item.title: Jason Mantzoukas | Trump's Weird Lie About Raking in Finland: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump making up another weird thing about a foreign country while attacking a retired admiral for not getting Osama bin Laden sooner.

Jason Mantzoukas talks about playing a drifter in The Long Dumb Road and reveals what he's like on road trips, plus he talks about his cameo in the comic book Mister Miracle.

Then, Jason sticks around backstage for a few more questions at Studio 8G.

item.title: David Sedaris | Trump Is Depressed After the Midterms: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's post-election funk as the Blue Wave that put Democrats in charge of the House keeps getting bigger.

Then, David Sedaris talks about his new passion of picking up garbage and the comeback he wishes he dished out when questioned at the British House of Commons.

After that, Sedaris reads an essay from his new book, Calypso, just for this podcast. It begins at 20:17.

item.title: Trump and His Fellow Grifters Lie About "Voter Fraud": A Closer Look | Paul Dano
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look President Trump becoming more lawless amid a power grab at the Justice Department and a recount in Florida.

Then, Paul Dano talks about collaborating with his wife, Zoe Kazan, on the film Wildlife and explains why he was terrified she would be eaten by a bear.

He also takes a few more questions backstage just for this podcast.

item.title: Hallie Jackson | Trump Freaks Out After Democrats Win House: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump freaking out about Democrats winning back the House and his moves to hamstring the Russia investigation.

item.title: Billy Eichner | Democrats Take Control of the House: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Democrats winning back control of the House of Representatives tonight for the first time in eight years, putting Trump’s agenda in serious danger.

Then, Billy Eichner celebrates the Democrats flipping the House of Representatives and commiserates with Beto O'Rourke's supporters.

item.title: Michael Moore | Trump's Racist Fearmongering Is His Latest Scam: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the only strategy Republicans are using for the midterms: making up a racist scam to scare people.

Then, Michael Moore stops by to discuss politics just days before the midterm elections. He also fills out his absentee ballot with Seth.

After that, Moore and Late Night supervising producer Henry Melcher leave 30 Rock to mail Moore's ballot. On the way they discuss what's at stake in the upcoming elections, and why Moore advises that people would be foolish to count out Trump and the GOP.

item.title: Chris Gethard | Trump Attacks the Media as His Allies Blame "Both Sides" for Violence: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump once again attacking the media while his allies blame "both sides" for violent rhetoric after a week of horrific attacks.

Then, he talks to Chris Gethard, who recaps his recent traumatizing haircut and talks about his book Lose Well.

Gethard also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Nicolle Wallace | David Cross | Trump Says He’s "Being Nice" While Lying About Health Care: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's closing argument for the midterms: lying about health care, immigration and a made-up tax cut.

Then, Nicolle Wallace talks about Trump's attacks on the press, her tenure in the Bush administration and why she thinks it's important for Democrats to take the House and Senate. She takes the conversation backstage exclusive for the podcast.

Then, David Cross explains the chain of events that led to him being interviewed by the Secret Service and talks about his efforts to help fight voter suppression. He also speaks backstage at Studio 8G just for the podcast.

item.title: Ike Barinholtz | Trump Campaigns for Republicans, Calls Democrats an "Angry Mob": A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump openly celebrating violence against a reporter as Saudi Arabia lies about the death of a journalist.

Then, Ike Barinholtz confesses a mistake he made on The Howard Stern Show, explains what inspired his movie The Oath and vents about the lack of DILF porn.

After that, Ike sticks around to take a few more questions from Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: Interpol Interviewed By The 8G Band's Eli Janney
item.description:
When Interpol stopped by Late Night to perform their new song "If You Really Love Nothing," they also chatted backstage with their longtime friend Eli Janney, 8G Band keyboardist and member of the band Girls Against Boys.

Here is their discussion about Interpol's new album Marauder as well as Interpol and Eli's careers touring and recording.

item.title: Amanda Litman | Trump Defends Kavanaugh in Crazy Press Conference Amid FBI Probe: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's surreal press conference during which he defended his Supreme Court nominee after a last-minute Senate deal to allow an FBI investigation into the sexual assault allegations against Brett Kavanaugh.

Then, Seth talks to Amanda Litman, co-founder of Run For Something. She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Pete Davidson | Dr. Christine Blasey Ford and Brett Kavanaugh Testify: A Closer Look | Jokes Seth Can't Tell
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Dr. Christine Blasey Ford's testimony to the Senate about the allegations of sexual assault against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

After that, There are some jokes that just sound wrong coming from Seth, like the one about white men being the minority among this year's Democratic midterm candidates.

Then, Pete Davidson talks about one of his rejected SNL sketches, his engagement to Ariana Grande and the pet pig they share.

item.title: Ken Burns | Rod Rosenstein Chaos; Trump Attacks Kavanaugh's Accuser: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at conflicting news reports about Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein and at the president doubling down on his support for Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh.

Then, Ken Burns talks about the unbelievable stories in his documentary The Mayo Clinic: Faith - Hope - Science and the painstaking restoration of the first documentary he ever produced.

He also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Sebastian Maniscalco | The "Law and Order” President on Collusion and Kavanaugh: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump defending himself against accusations of Russian collusion and defending his Supreme Court nominee against accusations of sexual assault.

Then, comedian Sebastian Maniscalco tells Seth about his embarrassing experiences at the Toronto International Film Festival, the trials of parenting and his dad's unsolicited comedy advice. He also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Khaled Hosseini | Manafort Flips on Trump; Kavanaugh Accused of Sexual Assault: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's ex-campaign chairman flipping on him and the sexual assault allegations leveled against his Supreme Court nominee, Brett Kavanaugh.

Writer Khaled Hosseini talks about leaving his career as a doctor to become a full-time writer, his novel Sea Prayer and how everyone can help refugees in their own communities. He also talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Trump Lies About Puerto Rico Death Toll as GOP Braces for Midterms: A Closer Look | Ingrid Rojas Contreras
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump peddling another insane conspiracy theory about the death toll in Puerto Rico as Republicans brace themselves for the midterms.

Then, author Ingrid Rojas Contreras talks about real-life inspiration for her book Fruit of the Drunken Tree, portraying fictional versions of her family members in the book and her mother's fortune-telling business she ran out of the family attic. She also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G just for this podcast.

item.title: Trump Attacks Woodward, Demands Op-Ed Investigation: A Closer Look | Emma Thompson
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump calling for an investigation into the New York Times' anonymous op-ed and slamming Bob Woodward's book about the chaos in the White House.

Then, Emma Thompson talks about becoming a dame, playing a late night host in her film Late Night and talks about her first late night talk show appearance with Johnny Carson. She also takes a few more questions backstage just for the podcast.

item.title: Summer Friday #5: Midterm Cram (ft. Asha Rangappa, Former FBI Agent) | Summer Book Club
item.description:
In a new edition of Midterm Cram, Late Night writer Sal Gentile and producer Henry Melcher interview former FBI special agent Asha Rangappa about the threat of Russian interference in the upcoming elections, as well as the historically unusual nature of the Paul Manafort trial. Her interview begins at 5:23. (This interview was recorded on August 10.)

Then at 35:30, hear summer reading recommendations from Awkwafina, Lester Holt, Phoebe Robinson, Viet Thanh Nguyen and Jake Tapper.

All music by The 8G Band.

item.title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren | Omarosa and Rudy Giuliani Cause Problems for Trump: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's staffing decisions coming back to haunt him as his lawyers fumble their response to the Russia probe and his White House feuds with Omarosa.

Then, Senator Elizabeth Warren talks about returning to Congress after summer recess, why she loves the show Ballers and Republicans backing away from their tax cut.

item.title: Seth Rogen | Trump's Week of Corruption Scandals: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the truly unprecedented level of corruption swirling around the president of the United States.

Then, Seth Rogen tells Seth about his horrible Golden Globes accident, explains why he doesn't like cruise ships and reveals how he won a game show with his sister by cheating.

After that, Rogen takes a few more questions backstage with Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

Seth takes a closer look at Trump admitting that his campaign tried to collude with Russia and the major developments in the trial of Trump’s ex-campaign chairman, Paul Manafort.

Then, Lester Holt talks about the viral moment in his interview with President Trump and comments on Trump's attacks on the press.

item.title: Henry Winkler | Trump and Rudy Giuliani Panic Over the Russia Probe: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump getting more desperate for the adoration of his crowds as the trial of his ex-campaign chairman gets under way and his former lawyer turns on him.

Then, Henry Winkler talks about his childhood antics on New York City buses, his Emmy nomination for Barry and the inspiration for his character.

After that, just for the podcast, Winkler takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani Says Collusion Is Not a Crime: A Closer Look | Rebecca Makkai
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's defenders moving on from insisting that the president didn't collude with Russia to arguing that even if he did, it's not a crime.

Then, author Rebecca Makkai talks about exploring how the AIDS epidemic affected Chicago in her novel The Great Believers, reveals how her father smuggled poetry into Hungary and explains why she loves teaching.

She also takes a few more questions from Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Trump Avoids Reporters and Lies About His Tariffs: A Closer Look | Bo Burnham | Nimesh Patel
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump’s mounting legal and political troubles, his escalating war on the press and his lies to supporters about his economic agenda.

Bo Burnham talks about why being 13 is horrifying and fun (among other things) and reads aloud a letter he wrote to himself when he was in sixth grade. He also takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G.

Plus, hear Late Night warm-up comedian Ryan Reiss interview his fellow comic Nimesh Patel, and then hear Nimesh's set on Late Night.

item.title: Trump's Iran Threat; Carter Page and Michael Cohen: A Closer Look | Jacob Soboroff
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump once again accusing the FBI of "spying" on him while it turns out his own lawyer was, in fact, spying on him.

Then, Jacob Soboroff tells Seth about his very awkward conversation with Joe Biden, reporting on the U.S.-Mexico border and the problems with Trump's border wall.

After that, Soboroff takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night's Henry Melcher.

item.title: Katy Tur | GOP Refuses to Hold Trump Accountable on Russia: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Republicans have opposed every attempt to hold President Trump accountable for his comments on Russian election meddling.

Then, Seth talks to MSNBC's Katy Tur about her experience reporting on Donald Trump's relationship with Russia on the campaign trail. Then, exclusively for the podcast, she continues the conversation backstage with Late Night's Henry Melcher.

item.title: Trump's Summit with Putin: A Closer Look | Joel McHale
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin in Finland and delivering one of the most surreal performances by a president in modern American history.

Then, Joel McHale talks about his plans for his 22nd wedding anniversary, parenting and his recent ventures in playing Fortnite.

After that, Joel talks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage — our first ever podcast bonus interview while our guest was changing clothes.

item.title: Summer Friday #3: Michael Ian Black | Summer Book Club
item.description:
On the third episode of the Late Night Podcast: Summer Fridays, Seth has an exclusive longform interview with Michael Ian Black. They discuss the Pudd'nhead Festival, which Michael founded, trials and tribulations of fatherhood and how Twitter led Michael to write a New York Times op-ed about masculinity.

Then at 26:51, hear summer reading recommendations from Jonny Sun, Hanya Yanagihara and Seth Meyers.

item.title: Donald J. Trump's Salute to American Independence | Paul Rudd
item.description:
Donald J. Trump reads his book chronicling how America won its independence from Great Britain in honor of the Fourth of July. (You can also head to Late Night on YouTube to see an animated version.)

Then, "Ant-Man & the Wasp" star Paul Rudd talks about showing his kids movies that are inappropriate for their age, Big Slick Celebrity Weekend and why he doesn't want to be too good at bowling.

He also talks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G just for this podcast.

item.title: Midterm Cram (ft. Indivisible's María Urbina)
item.description:
In this bonus episode, A Closer Look supervising writer Sal Gentile and Late Night producer Henry Melcher catch up on the latest in the midterm races, notably the upset election of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez in New York.

Their special guest is María Urbina, the national political director of Indivisible, a grassroots organizing effort for progressive candidates.

item.title: Kennedy Retires; GOP Attacks Russia Probe: A Closer Look | Stacey Abrams
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republicans rushing to replace retiring Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy while simultaneously working to stop the Russia investigation.

Then, Stacey Abrams talks about her unique campaign strategy for the governorship of Georgia, how she relates to voters and her past as a romantic suspense novelist.

Abrams continues to talk backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Chris Hayes | Trump Goes to Nevada Amid Migrant Detention Crisis: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump trying to circumvent due process for detained migrants.

Then, MSNBC's Chris Hayes explains what he thinks drove the president to undo his family separation policy and discusses White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders being asked to leave a restaurant.

Hayes also takes a few more questions backstage.

item.title: Trump Holds Rally Amid Aftermath of Family Separation Policy: A Closer Look | Sen. Tammy Baldwin
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump retreating to the safe space of a campaign rally as the aftermath of his family separation policy came to light.

Then, Senator Tammy Baldwin talks about fighting outside interests in her reelection campaign and being the first openly gay senator elected to the United States Senate.

She also takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: Trump Lies About His Cruel Family Separation Policy: A Closer Look | Louie Anderson
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump attacking the Russia investigation while lying about his administration's cruel policy of separating families at the border.

Then, Louie Anderson explains how he came up with name of his Big Underwear tour, reveals he's an underwear hoarder and talks about his book Hey Mom.

After that, Louie talks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Comic Book Writer Tom King
item.description:
Comic book writer Tom King talks about his work as a CIA agent, writing Batman and Catwoman's wedding and why his kids aren't impressed about his career in comics and the CIA.

Then, exclusively for the podcast, King talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher and A Closer Look writer (and comics superfan) Sal Gentile about his work.

item.title: Summer Friday #2: Inside the Writers Room | Summer Book Club
item.description:
On the second edition of the Late Night Podcast: Summer Fridays, hear a special message from Trump's upcoming Space Force.

Then, a delicate issue is resolved in the Late Night writers room, represented by John Lutz and Mike Karnell and judged by Amber Ruffin.

After that, Late Night head writer Alex Baze and staff writer Mike Scollins talk about what it's like writing comedy during this unique time.

Finally, we hear summer book recommendations from Zach Woods, Rakesh Satyal and George Saunders.

item.title: Summer Friday #1: Midterm Cram (ft. Katy Tur) | Summer Book Club
item.description:
The first episode of the "Late Night with Seth Meyers Podcast: Summer Fridays" limited series features a new podcast segment, Midterm Cram, co-hosted by “A Closer Look” supervising writer Sal Gentile and producer Henry Melcher. Their inaugural guest is reporter Katy Tur of NBC News and MSNBC. Her segment begins at 08:36.

You'll also hear summer reading recommendations from Late Night favorites Ellie Kemper, Phoebe Robinson and Celeste Ng starting at 33:24.

All music by The 8G Band.

item.title: Ellie Kemper (And Mindy Kaling!) | Trump Cancels North Korea Summit, Pushes Crazy Spy Claim: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth previews "The Late Night with Seth Meyers Podcast: Summer Fridays", where we will release fully original episodes of the Late Night Podcast throughout the summer when Late Night is on hiatus. Look for the first episode in this feed starting June 1.

Then, Seth takes a closer look at the president canceling his summit with North Korea and pushing a baseless conspiracy theory about the Russia probe.

After that, Seth talks to Ellie Kemper (and Mindy Kaling, who hung around to visit her old friend from The Office) about the new season of Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt. Kemper also stuck around backstage exclusively for the podcast to talk to producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: Zach Woods | Trump Deals with New Russia and Michael Cohen Bombshells: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump and his inner circle have been bombarded by one damning bombshell after another in only 48 hours.

Then, Zach Woods talks about Silicon Valley and tells a story about an embarrassing Google search and learning karate at a Jewish community center.

After that, Woods talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Ronan Farrow | Michael Cohen Pay-to-Play Allegations; John Kelly's Immigration Comments: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the White House dealing with new revelations involving the president's fixer, Michael Cohen, and questions about its cruel policy of separating immigrant families.

Then, he talks to Pulitzer Prize winning author and journalist Ronan Farrow about Trump's high-stakes dealings with North Korea, the consequences of pulling out of the Iran deal and covering the sexual misconduct allegations against Harvey Weinstein.

Farrow continues the conversation backstage at Studio 8G with Late Night producer Henry Melcher exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Michelle Wolf | Trump Supporters Think He Deserves the Nobel Peace Prize: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the president violating the Iran deal, his CIA director nominee being grilled on her past involvement in torture and Trump's supporters calling for him to win the Nobel Peace Prize.

Then, Late Night alum Michelle Wolf talks about her White House Correspondents' Dinner performance, running a 50-mile race in Utah and preparing for her Netflix show, The Break.

After that, Michelle talks to producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani Keeps Making Things Worse for Trump: A Closer Look | Rukmini Callimachi | Sarah Kendzior
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the aftermath of Rudy Giuliani saying the president lied about paying hush money to Stormy Daniels, and how Trump's legal team still doesn't have their story straight.

Then, The New York Times' Rukmini Callimachi talks about going through ISIS' trash, chatting with its members in chat rooms and being the target of a threat from ISIS itself. She also takes a few more questions backstage with Late Night's Henry Melcher.

After that, writer Sarah Kendzior talks about studying dictators for her PhD, why she loves complaining and the systemic problems that will still exist once Trump is out of office. Then she speaks with Henry backstage just for this podcast.


LATE NIGHT ON SOCIAL

item.title: Seth Meyers & POLITICO's Isaac Dovere
item.description:
Edward-Isaac Dovere of POLITICO visited Seth at 30 Rock for the Off-Message podcast. Listen to their conversation as they discuss the 2011 White House Correspondents Dinner, covering Trump from a comedic perspective and what Seth would do if Trump wanted to be booked on Late Night.

item.title: Mike O'Brien | Rudy Giuliani Says Trump Lied About Stormy Daniels: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Rudy Giuliani telling everyone in an interview that the president lied about paying hush money to a porn star.

Then, A.P. Bio creator Mike O'Brien rants about British actors who think they have great American accents and explains why he thinks the Kama Sutra should be an audiobook. He also expands on his one-sided feud with Betty White.

As an added bonus, at 18:24 Seth and Mike continue the conversation backstage at Studio 8G, where they talk about their Chicago roots and how it informed their SNL careers.

item.title: Brian Koppelman & David Levien | A Closer Look: Trump's Michigan Rally Goes Off the Rails
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's typically unhinged performance at a campaign rally where he attacked the press and those who protest during the national anthem, and praised Kanye West.

Then, Billions co-creators Brian Koppelman and David Levien talk about how they first met as teenagers, finding inspiration in illegal poker lounges and the popularity of Billions with professional athletes.

After that, Brian and David – and Brian’s daughter Anna – take a few more questions from producer Sarah Jenks-Daly backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Patton Oswalt | Trump Goes on Fox & Friends and Freaks Out About Michael Cohen: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump freaking out about the various criminal investigations around him during a rambling interview on Fox & Friends.

Then, Patton Oswalt discusses late wife Michelle McNamara's book on the Golden State Killer, I'll Be Gone in the Dark, the most recent development in the case and reveals the inspiration for his character on A.P. Bio.

After that, Patton takes a few more questions backstage from producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Desus & Mero | Lily Allen | The Department of Veterans Affairs: The Check In
item.description:
Seth takes a break from breaking news to check in on the possible privatization of the Department of Veterans Affairs and Trump's promise to fix the agency.

Then, Desus & Mero talk about performing in front of a live audience at the Apollo, extended family coming out of the woodwork and all things politics. They also continue the conversation exclusively for this podcast with Late Night producer Henry Melcher.

As a special podcast bonus, singer Lily Allen stopped by the podcast while she was a musical guest on Late Night. She spoke with producer Sarah Jenks-Daly and talent executive Jeremiah Silva about her new album "No Shame" and the journey she experienced on the way to her current moment.

item.title: Seth Meyers' Wife Gave Birth in Their Apartment Lobby | Jason Reynolds
item.description:
Seth Meyers tells the dramatic story of his second son's birth. (Originally aired April 9, 2017.)

Then, Seth talks to author Jason Reynolds talks about writing the Miles Morales Spider-Man novel, finding inspiration in incarcerated youth and how he was treated when he went shopping at Gucci in Italy.

Reynolds then goes backstage to continue the conversation with Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Ari Melber | A Closer Look: Pee Tape Allegations; Paul Ryan Retires; Trump Attacks Mueller
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's allies ramping up their attacks on Robert Mueller and Paul Ryan's decision to get out of Washington.

Then, journalist Ari Melber talks about quoting hip-hop when talking politics, what Michael Cohen pleading the fifth could mean for Trump and writing a play about the Exxon Valdez oil spill in the third grade.

Finally, Melber takes a few more questions backstage exclusively for this podcast with producer Henry Melcher.

item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Lashes Out After Michael Cohen Raid | Sarah McBride
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at one of the most extraordinary moments of Donald Trump’s presidency: when the FBI raided the offices of his personal lawyer, Michael Cohen.

Then, activist Sarah McBride explains what she wants people to understand about the transgender community, opens up about her husband's death from cancer and remembers when she met Joe Biden for the first time.

After that, Late Night producer Henry Melcher continues the conversation backstage with McBride exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Scott Thompson | A Closer Look: Trump Breaks Silence on Stormy Daniels as Russia Probe Heats Up
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump floating the possibility of shuffling his Cabinet and breaking his silence on the Stormy Daniels scandal as the Russia investigation heats up.

Then, Scott Thompson admits to having a crush on Seth, and talks about how he joined The Kids in the Hall and when he knew the troupe's show was a success.

After that, Scott continues the conversation backstage with Late Night producer Kevin Miller exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Tayari Jones | A Closer Look: Trump's Easter Immigration Rant, Cabinet Turmoil
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump celebrating Easter by ranting about immigrants while more key members of his Cabinet are accused of corruption.

Then, author Tayari Jones explains the origin of the title of her book An American Marriage, gives advice to young aspiring writers and recounts her very Important call from Oprah.

Jones also speaks backstage with Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly just for this podcast.

item.title: McKay Coppins | The Check In: U.S. Cybersecurity
item.description:
While Late Night with Seth Meyers is on hiatus, please enjoy this new episode of the Late Night Podcast.

First, Seth takes a break from breaking news to check in on the United States' cybersecurity and how worried the country should be about a foreign power meddling in its elections again.

Then, Atlantic writer McKay Coppins talks about feeling a kinship with Seth for questioning Trump's political ambitions and gives his take on what really motivates the president.

Coppins continues talking to Late Night producer Henry Melcher behind the scenes about his background as a reporter and how he believes political journalism has been disrupted.

item.title: Thomas Middleditch | A Closer Look: Trump Trades Barbs with Biden as Legal Problems Mount
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's mounting legal woes, including his lead personal attorney quitting, multiple women suing him and Robert Mueller preparing a list of questions to ask him.

Then, Seth talks to Silicon Valley actor Thomas Middleditch, who also takes a few more questions exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Bill Hader | A Closer Look: Trump Attacks Mueller and McCabe; Facebook Suspends Cambridge Analytica
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump directly attacking the special counsel in the Russia investigation and Facebook's massive data breach.

Then, Bill Hader talks about bringing Stefon back to SNL, breaking during a particularly funny sketch with Cecily Strong and what SNL game show sketch had the best opening line.

Finally, Hader answers a few more questions with Late Night producer Kevin Miller at Studio 8G.

item.title: Lena Waithe | A Closer Look: Trump Lies to Trudeau, Fills His Staff with Loyalists
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump lying to Canada's prime minister, major news in the Russia investigation and rumors of more staff turnover at the White House.

Then, he talks to Lena Waithe of The Chi and Ready Player One about what motivated her to make The Chi, why she takes issue with New York City pizza and what she means when she says she wants to be like Kanye West.

She also takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: David Remnick | A Closer Look: Robert Mueller Investigates Trump's Kremlin Back Channel
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump's escalating scandals related to everything from Russian meddling to porn stars.

Then, he talks to The New Yorker editor David Remnick about how his experiences living in Russia inform his view on the Mueller investigation. New Yorker cartoon editor Emma Allen also talks about her work.

item.title: Mayor Eric Garcetti | A Closer Look: West Virginia Teachers' Strike, Trump's Trade Tirade
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the thousands of teachers on strike in West Virginia and how the constant turmoil in his administration is causing President Trump to lash out.

Then, Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti talks about the political perks of being a mayor, why local politics gives him hope and how his city is preparing for the 2028 Summer Olympics.

Mayor Garcetti then goes behind the scenes to discuss infrastructure and more in an exclusive segment.

item.title: Don Lemon | Jared Kushner's Engulfed in Scandal, Trump and Mr. Magoo: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the key White House aides mired in scandal, the Russia probe heating up and President Trump publicly attacking his own attorney general.

Then, Don Lemon talks about confronting the absurdity of the president's surrogates, reveals how he knows the president watches his show every night and explains why he admires the Parkland shooting student activists.

Lemon then talks backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Stephanie Wittels Wachs | A Closer Look: Trump, Parkland and the #NeverAgain Movement
item.description:
In today's episode, Seth takes a closer look at the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting and how the #NeverAgain movement continues to put pressure on Republicans and the NRA.

Then, Stephanie Wittels Wachs talks about her brother, comedian and writer Harris Wittels, his struggle with addiction and her memoir, Everything Is Horrible and Wonderful.

She then goes behind the scenes and takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

item.title: Carrie Brownstein | Late Night Chats: Michele Byrd McPhee & Yeji Cha-Beach
item.description:
Carrie Brownstein of "Portlandia" and the band Sleater-Kinney chats with Seth about the final season of the IFC sketch show she co-created with Fred Amisen. She then goes behind the scenes to talk about her early jobs with Late Night producer Kevin Miller.

Then, a brand new edition of Late Night Chats with Michele Byrd McPhee and Yeji Cha-Beach of the Late Night music department begins at 13:51.

item.title: John Mulaney | Rep. Seth Moulton | A Closer Look: Trump's Disturbing Week - Russia, Military Parade, Rob Porter
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Trump White House as they peddle conspiracy theories, attack immigrants and defend an aide accused of domestic violence.

John Mulaney describes why the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony is like a wedding - if every speech was given by the bride's ex-boyfriend - and what it's like to see Frank Sinatra in concert.

John then speaks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G for a few more questions backstage.

Next, Seth speaks to Congressman Seth Moulton about the popular Iraqi TV show he hosted during his time in the Marine Corps and why more veterans like him should challenge establishment politics by taking on incumbents.

Rep. Moulton then speaks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Malcolm Jenkins | Glenn Howerton | A Closer Look: Trump Uses Nunes Memo to Attack Russia Probe
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look the misleading memo written by House Republicans that President Trump claims vindicates him in the Russia probe.

Then, Philadelphia Eagles safety Malcolm Jenkins talks about becoming a Super Bowl champion for the second time and why this win means more than his first with the New Orleans Saints. Plus, he discusses his philanthropy work, including engaging with the police and members of the community through his Players Coalition, and explains why he won't accept an invitation to the White House from President Trump after his Super Bowl win.

Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly then goes backstage with Jenkins to discuss the work he's doing to bring awareness to the scourge of mass incarceration across the U.S.

Next, Glenn Howerton talks with Seth about A.P. Bio, reveals what teacher inspired him and explains what it was like growing up abroad.

After that, Late Night producer Kevin Miller talks to Howerton backstage to talk more about his experience making A.P. Bio, and the first time he met Charlie Day.

item.title: Maggie Haberman | A Closer Look: Trump and GOP Move to Release Controversial Russia Memo
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Republicans have concocted an elaborate fantasy about a conspiracy deep within the FBI to destroy Donald Trump.

Then, Seth speaks to The New York Times' Maggie Haberman about her relationship with the president and explains why Trump can't exist without the media.

Haberman then goes behind the scenes with Late Night producer Henry Melcher and writer Sal Gentile, where they discuss how Trump has affected the jobs of everyone whose work touches day-to-day news.

item.title: Lawrence O'Donnell | A Closer Look: Did Trump Try to Obstruct the Obstruction of Justice Investigation?
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Trump's administration was rocked by reports that he tried to fire Robert Mueller.

Then, Seth chats with MSNBC's Lawrence O'Donnell about what goes into a hosting a nightly opinion program as well as his suppressed Boston accent.

Finally, go behind the scenes with Lawrence as he chats with Late Night producer Henry Melcher.

item.title: David Duchovny | A Closer Look: The Women's March and the Government Shutdown
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how the one-year anniversary of the president's inauguration was marked by nationwide protests and a government shutdown that ended today despite Trump doing as little as possible to resolve it.

Then, he talks to David Duchovny about 25 years of The X-Files, and Duchovny explains why he thinks Agent Mulder is a horrible FBI agent. He also takes a few more questions backstage just for this podcast.

item.title: Esther Povitsky | A Closer Look: Trump, Stormy Daniels and a Possible Government Shutdown
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Republicans still face the looming possibility of a government shutdown because President Trump rejected a bipartisan deal to solve an immigration impasse he created.

Alone Together's Esther Povitsky tells Seth what it's like to work with The Lonely Island, why she set up a surveillance camera in her parents' home and how she got her start in comedy.

Then, Esther takes a few more questions backstage at 8G.

item.title: Matt Ingebretson & Jake Weisman | A Closer Look: Trump and GOP Face Fallout from His Racist Immigration Comments
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Trump has pulled off another successful pivot - this time from a conversation about whether he's mentally unstable to a conversation about the fact that he's a racist.

Then, Corporate's Matt Ingebretson and Jake Weisman talk about making the transition from comedians to actors and reveal their previous horrible corporate jobs.

After that, they take a few more questions backstage.

item.title: Lewis Black | A Closer Look: Trump Is Becoming More Erratic and Working Less
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump continuing to prove that he's an increasingly erratic president who's unfit for his job and apparently working even fewer hours and neglecting urgent issues.

Then, Lewis Black explains why he thinks more women should run for office and explains why he turned down the opportunity to speak with Donald Trump.

item.description:

Then, Aaron Sorkin talks with Seth about the true events his film, Molly's Game, is based on and explains the unique challenges he faced directing it.

item.description:

Then, Matt Smith dishes on what it's like to play Prince Philip on The Crown, including what Prince William thinks about it, and reflects on Doctor Who's devoted fan base.

item.title: Seth Rogen | Jokes Seth Can't Tell | A Closer Look: Trump Attacks the Press, Goes All-In for Roy Moore
item.description:
Prior to Tuesday's special election in Alabama, Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is pulling out all the stops to help elect an accused sexual predator in Alabama's special election.

Then: There are some jokes that just sound wrong coming from Seth, like the one about why gay men earn more money than straight men.

Next, Seth Rogen talks to Seth about The Disaster Artist, and after that talks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G.

item.content:encoded:
Prior to Tuesday's special election in Alabama, Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is pulling out all the stops to help elect an accused sexual predator in Alabama's special election.

Then: There are some jokes that just sound wrong coming from Seth, like the one about why gay men earn more money than straight men.

Next, Seth Rogen talks to Seth about The Disaster Artist, and after that talks to Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G.
