item.title: Michael Shannon | A Closer Look: Al Franken Resigns; Donald Trump Jr. Testifies in Russia Investigation
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Senator Al Franken's resignation amid a growing sexual harassment scandal and how Donald Trump Jr. testified in the Russia investigation and refused to answer some questions on the basis of attorney-client privilege.

Michael Shannon tells Seth all about filming The Shape of Water, including how he wrecked an old Cadillac on set and what it was like torturing a monster.

Then, Shannon talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G.

item.title: Ilana Glazer & Abbi Jacobson | A Closer Look: Trump, Flynn and Obstruction of Justice; Senate Passes GOP Tax Plan
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how one of President Trump's closest associates pleaded guilty on Friday to lying to the FBI and how Republicans forged ahead with a radical plan to slash taxes for corporations and the wealthy.

Then, Ilana Glazer and Abbi Jacobson share their fondest memories of performing at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre in Chelsea and take a moment to talk about DACA.

After they, Ilana and Abbi continue the discussion backstage.

item.title: Greta Gerwig | A Closer Look: Trump Backs Roy Moore; Charlie Rose Fired for Sexual Harassment
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the White House continuing to stand by an accused sexual predator running for Senate so they can pass tax cuts.

Then, he interviews Greta Gerwig, director and writer of the new film "Lady Bird." She tells Seth about the letters she sent Justin Timberlake, Alanis Morrissette and Dave Matthews to allow them to use her music in the movie.

Gerwig then spoke to Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly backstage where she answered a few additional questions exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Chris Hayes | A Closer Look: Sexual Harassment in Congress
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at a new sexual harassment allegation against Senator Al Franken and more women coming forward to accuse Roy Moore of sexually assaulting them as teenagers.

Then, MSNBC's Chris Hayes talks about why humanity's ability to adapt to anything has lessened the blow of every day's shocking news, and he shares his theory on what really motivates Donald Trump.

After that, Hayes dashes from Studio 8G to the production offices of "All in with Chris Hayes" a few floors below. He talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher during the journey.

item.content:encoded:
Seth takes a closer look at a new sexual harassment allegation against Senator Al Franken and more women coming forward to accuse Roy Moore of sexually assaulting them as teenagers.

Then, MSNBC's Chris Hayes talks about why humanity's ability to adapt to anything has lessened the blow of every day's shocking news, and he shares his theory on what really motivates Donald Trump.

After that, Hayes dashes from Studio 8G to the production offices of "All in with Chris Hayes" a few floors below. He talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher during the journey.

item.title: Martin McDonagh | A Closer Look: Donald Trump Jr. and WikiLeaks; Trump Meets Duterte
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump spent his trip to Asia cozying up to authoritarian strongmen and new information about the Trump campaign’s relationship with WikiLeaks.

Then, filmmaker and playwright Martin McDonagh discusses his film "In Bruges" with Seth and reveals how Frances McDormand almost had a buzz cut for the film "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri."

McDonagh also takes a few more questions backstage from Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly exclusively for this podcast.

item.title: Hillary Rodham Clinton | Will Ferrell | A Closer Look: Democrats Get Their First Big Electoral Wins of the Trump Era
item.description:
In this episode, Seth takes a closer look at how Trump and his supporters on Fox News are doing everything they can to downplay the Democrats' big wins in New Jersey and Virginia. [ 0:29 ]

Then, Hillary Rodham Clinton visits Late Night on the anniversary of the 2016 election. She discusses her concerns about the Trump administration and why she's optimistic about the future of the Democratic party. [ 9:18 ]

Audience warm-up comedian Ryan Reiss then interviews an audience member about issues facing the country. [ 19:13 ]

Next, Seth interviews Will Ferrell about his new movie Daddy's Home 2, and his favorite rejected SNL sketch that could be resurrected in Second Chance Theatre. [ 20:18 ]

Finally, Will answers a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G with Late Night producer Kevin Miller. [ 29:36 ]

(Photos: Lloyd Bishop/©NBC)

item.title: Michael Lewis | A Closer Look: Trump Travels to Asia as Russia Probe Escalates
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Trump can’t seem to escape the escalating Russia investigation, even when he is abroad in Asia.

Then, Michael Lewis explains the breadth of responsibilities the USDA has, such as policing disputes between animals and people, and why it really matters who Trump appoints to run it.

Late Night producer Henry Melcher then asks Lewis a few more questions backstage.

item.title: Seth Meyers & Mike Shoemaker
item.description:
To commemorate the first anniversary of the Late Night podcast, Seth Meyers and Late Night producer Mike Shoemaker sat down in the 30 Rock offices to talk about their history working in TV together, how Late Night has evolved and why they bicker like a married couple but wouldn't have it any other way.

They also answer some fan questions about their lives and careers.

(Photo: Lloyd Bishop/©NBC)

item.title: Rosie O'Donnell | A Closer Look: GOP Unveils Tax Plan, Trump Lashes Out After Terror Attack
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how an increasingly authoritarian-sounding Trump is flailing as Republicans squabble over his signature piece of legislation, his tax cut plan.

Rosie O'Donnell explains the origins of her long-running feud with Donald Trump and her plans to get a Robert Mueller tattoo.

She then speaks with Late Night producer Kevin Miller about her opinions on Hollywood and Broadway sexual harassment, and the next steps.

item.title: Anthony Bourdain | A Closer Look: Mueller Indicts Three Former Trump Officials In Russia Investigation
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at special counsel Robert Mueller's first charges in his investigation of the Trump campaign's potential ties to Russia.

Then, Anthony Bourdain tells Seth about the difficulties of filming Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown and why Romanian newspapers accused him of being a Mossad agent. He also discusses the troubles Puerto Rico faced before and after the hurricane, and why he's apologized about perpetuating the oppressive "meathead culture" in cuisine.

After that, Bourdain talks to Late Night producer Henry Melcher about how hipsters have shaped food culture and his meal with President Obama.

item.title: Mikey Day & Streeter Seidell | Fox News Showers Trump with Praise, Obsesses Over Hillary: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Trump administration's seemingly permanent state of scandal and why many on the right seem to want to live in an alternate reality where Trump isn't president.

Mikey Day and Seth discuss the David S. Pumpkins Animated Halloween Special and his favorite sketch pitches that never made it to SNL.

Then, Late Night producer Kevin Miller goes backstage at Studio 8G to ask a few more questions to Day and his SNL supervising writer, and co-creator of David S. Pumpkins, Streeter Seidell.

item.title: Trump's Tax Plan, Twitter Insults and Rambling Fox News Interview: A Closer Look | Jokes Seth Can't Tell | Cole Sprouse
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump has retreated to Fox News in the wake of recent scandals in an effort to push his domestic agenda.

Then, Jokes Seth Can't Tell. There are some jokes that just sound wrong coming from Seth, like the one about the biggest difference between a straight wedding and a gay wedding.

Finally, Cole Sprouse of "Riverdale" talks to Seth about his insistence on Jughead's dog breed and his tweets.

item.title: Taran Killam | Harvey Weinstein, Donald Trump and Systemic Sexism: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how powerful men in entertainment and politics - from Harvey Weinstein to Donald Trump - abuse their power to silence, bully or coerce. (0:34)

Then, he talks to Taran Killam, who explains how fun it was to work with Arnold Schwarzenegger on his film Killing Gunther. (10:42)

Killam also speaks with Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Late Night. (19:12)

item.title: Sen. Cory Booker | Pence's NFL stunt, Trump vs. Bob Corker and Puerto Rico: A Closer Look
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump whips up racial tensions with transparent political stunts, while the humanitarian crisis in Puerto Rico continues. (0:49)

Then, Seth interviews Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) about the worst-kept secret in Washington D.C.: both sides of the aisle are very concerned about President Trump. (12:22)

Exclusively for this podcast, Late Night producer Henry Melcher asks Sen. Booker a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G. (20:43)

item.title: Trump Attacks the Mayor of San Juan: A Closer Look | Salman Rushdie | Celeste Ng
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the very real consequences of electing a lazy, ignorant racist as president. Then, Seth speaks to authors Salman Rushdie and Celeste Ng. After Seth's interviews, Late Night producers Henry Melcher and Sarah Jenks-Daly continue the conversations backstage with the writers exclusively for this podcast. item.title: Trump's Tax Plan: A Closer Look | Jeff Garlin | Jesmyn Ward
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is outright lying about the fate of his health care bill and his new tax plan. Then, he speaks with Jeff Garlin and author Jesmyn Ward, both of whom continue the conversation backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: Republicans Can't Defend Their Health Care Bill | Billie Jean King
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republicans, who are once again making a mad dash to rush through an Obamacare repeal bill without being able to defend or explain what it does. Then, tennis legend Billie Jean King tells Seth about the time she met then-President Obama, who admitted watching her Battle of the Sexes tennis match on TV was life changing for him as a father of two girls. Late Night producer Henry Melcher then asks King about her experience as the inspiration for an Elton John song and more. item.title: Manafort, Rocket Man and the New GOP Health Care Bill: A Closer Look | Gilbert Gottfried
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how the GOP is trying to ram through a plan to repeal and replace Obamacare while waiting for what could be the Russia investigation's first indictment. Then, Seth talks to legendary comedian Gilbert Gottfried about the new documentary he stars in, "Gilbert." Gottfried also takes a few more questions backstage with Late Night producer Kevin Miller. item.title: Trump and Democrats Discuss a DACA Deal: A Closer Look | Jeffrey Tambor
item.description:
Hank Kingsley comes out of retirement to announce the Late Night Podcast! Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is making a renewed push to get Democrats on board with his agenda. Then, hear Seth's interview with Jeffrey Tambor about the bookstore he owns, as well as the new season of "Transparent." He also takes a few more questions backstage with Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly. item.title: Trump Responds to Irma, Bannon Speaks Out: A Closer Look | Jill Kargman
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how President Trump is dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Irma and a brewing storm in his own party over his decision to strike a deal with Democrats. Then, Jill Kargman describes her real-life inspiration for the laugh-out-loud moments on Odd Mom Out and getting tattoos with her 79-year-old dad. item.title: Trump Ends DACA, Responds to Hurricane Harvey: A Closer Look | Jake Tapper
item.description:
CNN's Jake Tapper discusses the dangerous threat Donald Trump's move to end DACA poses and how Sean Hannity's plan to turn viewers against him backfired. (0:20) Then, Seth chats with CNN's Jake Tapper, who discusses the dangerous threat Donald Trump's move to end DACA poses and how Sean Hannity's plan to turn viewers against him backfired. (9:37) After that, Tapper becomes the first ever repeat guest on the Late Night podcast as he takes a few more questions from Late Night's Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G. (0:20) Then, Seth chats with CNN's Jake Tapper, who discusses the dangerous threat Donald Trump's move to end DACA poses and how Sean Hannity's plan to turn viewers against him backfired. (9:37) After that, Tapper becomes the first ever repeat guest on the Late Night podcast as he takes a few more questions from Late Night's Henry Melcher backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: Anthony Atamanuik | Brian Knappenberger
item.description:
Anthony Atamanuik of The President Show joins Seth to discuss his Trump impression, and then speaks with Kevin Miller about why he runs his show like the White House. Then, filmmaker Brian Knappenberger discusses press freedom in our current age. After his interview with Seth, he speaks further with Late Night producer Henry Melcher. item.title: Steve Bannon Comes to Trump's Defense on Charlottesville: A Closer Look | Michael Moore
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the tailspin Donald Trump's presidency has been in since his response to violence in Charlottesville and the key aides coming to his defense, Steve Bannon and Fox News. (0:20) Then, Late Night's warm-up comic Ryan Reiss talks to a member of our live audience about her experience at the show and how she's feeling during the Trump administration. (7:36) After that, Michael Moore lays out all the ways Democrats could have an upper hand in the midterm elections, what we need to give Trump credit for and why President Trump really is more dangerous than a President Pence. item.title: Donald Trump's Charlottesville Press Conference: Breaking Crazy | Bryan Fogel
item.description:
Seth breaks down the crazy that came out of President Trump's most recent press conference, where he seemed to side with white supremacists in the wake of the events in Charlottesville. (0:20) Then, filmmaker Bryan Fogel explains how he unintentionally documented the Russian Olympic doping scandal for his film Icarus and helped the mastermind escape to the U.S. (2:30) After that, Fogel takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G from Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly. item.title: Trump Doubles Down on N. Korea Threats While Aides Praise Him: A Closer Look | Sen. Tammy Duckworth
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Donald Trump is handling tensions surrounding North Korea's nuclear weapons program and the aides he's relying on to boost his ego during this tense exchange. Then, Senator Tammy Duckworth breaks down why President Trump should stop trying to "out-crazy" Kim Jong-un and how his transgender military ban is "foolish at best." After her interview with Seth, Sen. Duckworth spoke with Late Night producer Henry Melcher for a podcast exclusive segment backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: Trump Goes on Vacation While His Team Debuts So-Called "Real News" | Billy Eichner
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Trump team's effort to ramp up attacks on the Russia probe and news media despite the President being on vacation. (0:20) Then, Billy Eichner explains how he used Trump to campaign for Billy on the Street's first Emmy nomination and lays out strong arguments for why he deserves to win his category over Saturday Night Live. item.title: Scaramucci and Priebus Are Out, Trump Threatens to Blow Up Obamacare: A Closer Look | Jim Gaffigan
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Trump White House in turmoil after the sudden firing of Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci days after the resignation of former Chief of Staff Reince Priebus. (0:20) Then, comedian Jim Gaffigan chats with Seth about his wife's brain surgery to remove a tumor and why he'd love to be an anesthesiologist. (10:51) Gaffigan, joined by his wife and one of his daughters, then chats a little longer with Late Night producer Kevin Miller backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: Scaramucci Lashes Out, GOP Scrambles on Health Care: A Closer Look | Andrea Mitchell
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the backlash the Trump White House continues to face over the President's cruel and sudden decision to ban transgender people from serving in the military, as well as incoming White House Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci's wild interview with The New Yorker. (0:20) Then, NBC News foreign affairs correspondent Andrea Mitchell gives her take on Senate Republicans' health care confusion, Trump's surprise ban on transgender people in the military and the administration's aversion to free press. (13:20) Mitchell then goes backstage to take a few more questions exclusive to this podcast from Late Night producer Henry Melcher. item.title: Spicer's Out, Scaramucci's In and Kushner Speaks: A Closer Look | Fred Savage
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's most recent attacks on the Russia investigation, his secret health care bill and his communications staff shake-up. (0:20) Then, Fred Savage explains to Seth why he doesn't hang out with his co-stars after filming and reveals what he's actually doing when everyone else is out on the town. item.title: Trump Turns on Sessions Amid Russia Probe: A Closer Look | Dave Portnoy
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's New York Times interview, in which he lashes out at his own attorney general and threatens the special counsel investigating him. item.title: Team Trump's Absurd Defenses for Don Jr.'s Emails: A Closer Look | Eric Schneiderman
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the Trump administration's excuses for their behavior amid bombshell revelations about Donald Trump Jr.'s meeting with Russians. (0:19) Then, Attorney General Eric Schneiderman talks to Seth about how he wound up on Donald Trump's enemies list, what it's like to sue the President and protecting the country from Washington D.C.'s bad idea toxic volcano. (14:28) Schneiderman then goes backstage to answer a few more questions from Late Night producer Henry Melcher exclusively for this podcast. item.title: Trump Doesn't Seem to Know Anything About Health Care: A Closer Look | Edgar Wright
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republicans frantically working behind closed doors to win enough votes for their Senate health care bill and how President Trump is complicating their efforts. (0:22) Then, director Edgar Wright explains how action movie synesthesia inspired his film Baby Driver, why Jon Hamm now calls him "a floppy, sunburned Muppet" and why shunting is not as dirty as it sounds. (11:15) Wright then takes a few more questions backstage. item.title: Senate Trumpcare Would Leave 22 Million More Uninsured: A Closer Look | Mayor Pete Buttigieg
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's ever-changing story about why he fired James Comey and the latest GOP tactics for promoting their health care bill that could leave 22 million people uninsured. (0:22) Then, Mayor Pete Buttigieg of South Bend, Indiana chats with Seth about successfully governing as a progressive Democrat in a very red state. (11:49) After that, Late Night producer Henry Melcher asks Mayor Buttigieg a few more questions about his responsibility to the people of South Bend backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: Senate GOP Tries to Rush Trumpcare: A Closer Look | Really!?! with Seth & Amy | Kumail Nanjiani
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the health care bill draft Senate Republicans finally unveiled after weeks of secret, closed-door meetings. Then, Seth and Amy Poehler revive a signature segment from their time as Weekend Update co-anchors, Really!?! with Seth & Amy. This time around, they address the conservative outrage surrounding a New York production of Shakespeare's Julius Caesar that comments on modern-day American politics. Then, Seth interviews actor and comedian Kumail Nanjiani, who shares some of the harsh, and occasionally racist, personal comments people said about his movie The Big Sick, which is the real-life love story of him and his wife. Afterwards, Kumail talks about his stand-up roots to Late Night producer Henry Melcher as a podcast bonus. item.title: Is Trump Under Investigation? He and His Lawyers Disagree: A Closer Look | Lizzy Goodman
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump and his supporters lashing out over the special counsel investigation into his ties to Russia. Lizzy Goodman explains how she came to write definitive rock oral history Meet Me in the Bathroom: Rebirth and Rock and Roll in New York City 2001–2011 and her method for prying hundreds of firsthand testimonials from rock's most influential stars. After her interview with Seth, Goodman then takes a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G with Late Night producer Sarah Jenks-Daly. item.title: Terry Gross Interviews Seth Meyers | Trump Under Investigation: A Closer Look | Patty Jenkins
item.description:
On today's show, you'll hear an excerpt from Seth's interview with Terry Gross live in Philadelphia that helped commemorate 30 years of Fresh Air with Terry Gross. You can listen to their full interview on the Fresh Air podcast or right here: http://www.npr.org/2017/06/14/532861051/for-our-30th-anniversary-fresh-air-tapes-live-with-seth-meyers-of-late-night Then, Seth takes a closer look at reports that President Trump is personally under investigation for obstruction of justice as Senate Republicans edge closer to passing a secret health care bill. After that, Patty Jenkins chats with Seth about directing blockbuster Wonder Woman and what kids think about about the superhero lead being a girl. She also takes a few more questions backstage with Late Night producer Henry Melcher. item.title: Jeff Sessions Testifies; GOP Writes Secret Health Care Bill: A Closer Look | Janet Mock
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Attorney General Jeff Sessions' Senate testimony and President Trump's allies call for the firing of the special counsel in charge of the Russia investigation, Robert Mueller. Author and trans activist Janet Mock explains why her second memoir, Surpassing Certainty: What My Twenties Taught Me, is really the first she wanted to write and why she's hopeful about the future despite the current political climate. Then, Mock talks to Late Night producer Henry backstage at Late Night about her new podcast "Never Before" and her writing style. item.title: James Comey Testifies, Says Trump Lied: A Closer Look | Desus & Mero
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at former FBI Director James Comey's Senate testimony that President Trump lied about his reasons for firing him and the Republicans' defense of POTUS' actions. Then, Viceland hosts of Desus & Mero, Desus Nice and The Kid Mero, chat about why Donald Trump is like your most unqualified co-worker and how unimpressed their families are by their growing fame. After their interview, Desus and Mero continue the conversation backstage, where they reveal their origin story and experience making TV versus podcasting. item.itunes:title: James Comey Testifies, Says Trump Lied: A Closer Look | Desus & Mero
item.itunes:summary:
Seth takes a closer look at former FBI Director James Comey's Senate testimony that President Trump lied about his reasons for firing him and the Republicans' defense of POTUS' actions. Then, Viceland hosts of Desus & Mero, Desus Nice and The Kid Mero, chat about why Donald Trump is like your most unqualified co-worker and how unimpressed their families are by their growing fame. After their interview, Desus and Mero continue the conversation backstage, where they reveal their origin story and experience making TV versus podcasting. item.title: Trump Picks Fights on Twitter, Pisses Off World: A Closer Look | John Early
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the latest fights President Trump has picked with the rest of the world as his approval ratings hit new lows. Then, actor and comedian John Early talks about his small, but significant, role in Beatriz at Dinner and how a compliment from Salma Hayek set his nerves at ease on set. He explains how he became obsessed with Toni Collette at 11 years old before acting out a scene she performed in The Sixth Sense. item.title: Bonus Episode: Looking Back At The Insanity Of May 2017
item.description:
"Late Night with Seth Meyers" is on hiatus this week, but after we wrapped last week, segment producer Henry Melcher and A Closer Look writer Sal Gentile sat down and looked back at the news cycle that lasted throughout May 2017. From the Yates testimony to the firing of James Comey to the FBI's recent focus on Jared Kushner, the pace of news last month was breakneck and often bled into the "Late Night" production schedule. Henry and Sal discuss how their jobs have been affected, and how the nonstop barrage is affecting citizens' understanding of their political leaders. item.title: Trump's Cruel Budget Breaks His Campaign Promises: A Closer Look | Tom Perez
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the release of President Trump's first full budget and mounting evidence that POTUS tried to obstruct justice in the Russia investigation. Then, Seth talks to Democratic National Committee chair Tom Perez. item.title: Trump Goes Abroad Amid Escalating Russia Probe: A Closer Look | Sen. John McCain
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the scandals awaiting Donald Trump at home when he returns from his first foreign trip as president. (0:20) Then, Seth talks to Senator John McCain about his role as a statesman in the Trump administration. (9:51) In a podcast exclusive, Senator McCain then talks to producer Henry Melcher backstage about whether he prefers going on comedy programs or news programs. item.description:

(0:20) Then, Seth and Michael Barbaro discuss how the unpredictability of the Trump administration affects New York Times' podcast, The Daily. item.title: Trump Asked Comey to End Flynn Probe, Gave Russians Intel: A Closer Look | Sen. Ben Sasse
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the White House playing damage control after bombshell reports about President Trump sharing classified info with Russia and asking the FBI to drop investigations into his former National Security Advisor. (0:21) Then, Senator Ben Sasse gives his big-picture opinion about reports that President Trump may have shared classified info with the Russian foreign minister and ambassador. He also expresses his views about rebuilding public trust in government, what he thinks Donald Trump should be focusing on, and the future of Russia's cyber attacks. (12:19) Sen. Sasse and Late Night producer Henry Melcher then discuss more about the senator's real public safety objective. item.title: Trump's Shifting Story on Firing Comey: A Closer Look | Aziz Ansari | Wally Feresten & Lloyd Bishop
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's contradicting remarks about his decision to fire FBI Director James Comey. Next, Seth chats with Aziz Ansari, the creator and star of Netflix's "Master of None." They discuss some Islamophobia stories that didn't make it into Season 2, and the time Aziz mastered some key Japanese phrases only to insult a Korean man at a sushi restaurant. Then you'll hear a new Late Night Chats segment, featuring Late Night's head of cue cards Wally Feresten and our show photographer Lloyd Bishop. item.title: Cecile Richards (Podcast Exclusive) | GOP Defends Health Care Bill: A Closer Look
item.description:
On today’s show, Seth takes a closer look at the revelation then-President Obama warned Trump against ousted NSA head Michael Flynn and the fallout from the Republicans' unpopular health care bill. (This segment originally aired on Monday, May 8.) (0:23) Then, in a podcast exclusive segment, Seth interviews Cecile Richards, the president of Planned Parenthood Federation of America. They have a wide-ranging discussion in the Late Night offices ahead of her appearance on the show, touching on the services Planned Parenthood provides as well as the current state of enthusiasm for the program. (13:20) Next, you’ll hear Cecile’s interview on Late Night, which originally aired on Tuesday, May 9. (This segment originally aired on Monday, May 8.) (0:23) Then, in a podcast exclusive segment, Seth interviews Cecile Richards, the president of Planned Parenthood Federation of America. They have a wide-ranging discussion in the Late Night offices ahead of her appearance on the show, touching on the services Planned Parenthood provides as well as the current state of enthusiasm for the program. (13:20) Next, you’ll hear Cecile’s interview on Late Night, which originally aired on Tuesday, May 9. item.title: House Republicans Pass Trumpcare: A Closer Look | Shane Smith | Tara Donnelly & Manny Morales
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the House Republicans rushing a bill, which will strip health insurance from millions of Americans, without knowing what's in it. (0:20) Then, VICE's Shane Smith talks to Seth about his idiosyncratic adventures across the globe. He also talks to segment producer Henry Melcher for a few additional questions backstage in a podcast exclusive. (11:03) In a new edition of Late Night Chats, Tara Donnelly and Manny Morales of the Late Night graphics team chat about their day-to-day task of creating art for Late Night. item.title: Trump Admits Being POTUS Is Hard, Flubs the Civil War: A Closer Look | Rachel Maddow
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump's latest revelations, including that he doesn't really know why the Civil War happened. (0:19) Next, Rachel Maddow talks to Seth about the impact the Trump administration has had on the news cycle and recalls an unrecorded conversation with Donald Trump during Republican primaries. She breaks down the benefits and drawbacks to Donald Trump not knowing how policy and government work and who the Democratic Party needs to follow to future victory. item.title: Trump's First 100 Days: A Closer Look | Seth Meyers & Jan Böhmermann (Plus Exclusive Backstage Chat)
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Donald Trump's first 100 days in office as he and Congress face an imminent government shutdown deadline. (0:22 - 11:38) Then, Seth welcomes German comedian Jan Böhmermann to Late Night. They chat about what it's like having a late night comedy show in Germany, a country not well known for its sense of humor. (11:59 - 17:41) Finally, in a segment exclusive to this podcast, Seth and Jan go backstage at Studio 8G to speak more at length about Jan's background. They also discuss Germany's unique position in Europe as one of the lone countries that has been resistant to the far-right extremist politics sweeping the rest of the continent. (17:44 - 34:06) LATE NIGHT ON SOCIAL Rate the Late Night Podcast on iTunes: itunes.com/LateNightSeth Subscribe to Late Night on YouTube: youtube.com/LateNightSeth Follow Late Night on Twitter: twitter.com/LateNightSeth Like Late Night on Facebook: www.facebook.com/LateNightSeth Find Late Night on Snapchat: snapchat.com/add/LateNightSeth Get more Late Night with Seth Meyers: www.nbc.com/late-night-with-seth-meyers/ Watch Late Night with Seth Meyers weeknights 12:35/11:35c on NBC. item.title: Seth Meyers Interviews SNL Writer Julio Torres (Podcast Exclusive)
item.description:
On today's episode, Seth interviews writer/comedian Julio Torres about working at Saturday Night Live. They discuss how Julio got from El Salvador to the SNL writers' room, and dig deep into the inspiration behind some of his most notable sketches like Wells For Boys and The Sink. Then, you'll hear Julio's recent stand-up set from his appearance on Late Night. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump/Nunes Story Gets Weirder | Craig Ferguson | George Saunders
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's record low approval rating and the GOP's plan to allow Internet companies to sell people's Internet data. Then, Seth talks to comedian Craig Ferguson and author George Saunders, both of whom have more to say backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: A Closer Look: Is Nunes Investigating Trump or Working with Him? | Joe Scarborough & Mika Brzezinski
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the House Intelligence Committee's investigation into the Trump administration's alleged ties to Russia. Then, he talks to Morning Joe's Joe Scarborough & Mika Brzezinski about their history with Trump and what they believe will come next. They also take a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G. In this episode, Seth takes a closer look at the ongoing Russia scandal and the GOP's health care bill. (0:23 - 10:45) Then, he welcomes MSNBC's Chris Hayes, who discusses his new book "A Colony in a Nation." As added bonus just for this podcast, Late Night producer Henry Melcher then asks Hayes a few more questions as he dashes across 30 Rock from Studio 8G to his MSNBC studio just moments before taping "All In." (11:06 - 19:50) Finally, enjoy a new edition of Late Night Chats, this time featuring Late Night stage manager Steve Bautista and warm-up comedian Ryan Reiss. item.title: A Closer Look: Comey Hearing Adds to Chaos of Trump Presidency | Interview: Will Forte
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the FBI's investigation into Russia's interference in the presidential election, and President Trump's wiretapping claims. Then, Seth talks to his old friend Will Forte, who created and stars in "The Last Man on Earth," about his nickname Uncle Stinky, and his on-set challenge with co-star Mary Steenburgen. Then, in a podcast exclusive, he tells a few more stories backstage about an unfortunate poison oak rash and more to Late Night producer Kevin Miller. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump's Cruel Budget Caps off Bad Week | Interview: Erin Gibson & Bryan Safi
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's latest travel ban block, the debunking of his wiretapping claims and his drastic new budget plan. Then, he talks to Throwing Shade's Erin Gibson and Bryan Safi, who fill Seth in on Second Lady Karen Pence's towel charm business, and about some new additions to their shade list. Late Night producer Kevin Miller then speaks to them backstage at Studio 8G for a few more questions. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump's Lies on Wiretapping, Health Care | Interview: Author Mohsin Hamid
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's outlandish claims on wiretapping and the Republican plan to repeal and replace Obamacare. Then, author Mohsin Hamid chats with Seth about his new novel, Exit West, as well as Trump's travel ban and how storytelling is important during times like these. Late Night producer Henry Melcher then goes backstage with Mohsin to ask a few more questions. item.title: Late Night Chats: Sal & Henry | Interviews: Dr. Ben Santer & Paul Beatty
item.description:
On this podcast, you'll hear Late Night segment producer Henry Melcher chat with staff writer Sal Gentile about how he writes A Closer Look and more. Then, Seth chats with climate scientist Dr. Ben Santer about his concerns about environmental policies, followed by his interview with Man Booker Prize winning author Paul Beatty, who touches on his discomfort of labeling his work "satire." item.title: A Closer Look: Jeff Sessions, Trump and Russia | Interview: Reza Aslan
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at major new questions surrounding the Trump campaign's alleged contacts with Russia. (0:21 - 10:48) Then, Reza Aslan talks to Seth about his new show "Believer," in which he immerses himself in the world's religions, and why he doesn't feel immigrants are automatically protected in America right now. He also speaks to Late Night producer Henry for a few more questions backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Prepares Address | Jokes Seth Can't Tell | Whoopi Goldberg & Dustin Lance Black
item.description:
Today's show kicks off with A Closer Look from Monday, February 27, when Seth took a closer look at President Trump's preparations to address Congress for the first time and his "agenda" thus far. (0:22 - 9:40) Then, Late Night writers Amber Ruffin and Jenny Hagel join Seth for the segment Jokes Seth Can't Tell, where they provide the punchlines to jokes that would not sound right coming from Seth. (9:52 - 14:24) Seth then chats with Whoopi Goldberg and Dustin Lance Black about their new LGBT docudrama miniseries "When We Rise." Black then answers a few more questions from Late Night producer Kevin backstage at Studio 8G. item.title: A Closer Look: GOP Town Hall Protests / Paul Scheer & Rob Huebel / Seth Reiss & Mike Karnell
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Republican members of Congress facing constituents in their home districts that are angry about Trump and the GOP's agenda. (0:22 - 10:10) Then, he interviews comedians Paul Scheer and Rob Huebel, who talk about their new show Drive Share. Late Night producer Henry goes backstage with them for a few more questions. (10:31 - 18:22) Finally, you'll hear another edition of Late Night Chats, this time featuring Late Night supervising writer Seth Reiss and segment director Mike Karnell. They discuss their collaborations such as this week's "Oscar Bait" sketch. (18:35 - 37:50) LATE NIGHT ON SOCIAL Rate the Late Night Podcast on iTunes: itunes.com/LateNightSeth Subscribe to Late Night on YouTube: youtube.com/LateNightSeth Follow Late Night on Twitter: twitter.com/LateNightSeth Like Late Night on Facebook: www.facebook.com/LateNightSeth Find Late Night on Snapchat: snapchat.com/add/LateNightSeth Get more Late Night with Seth Meyers: www.nbc.com/late-night-with-seth-meyers/ Watch Late Night with Seth Meyers Weeknights 12:35/11:35c on NBC.

item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Attacks the Press / Interviews: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand & Jordan Peele
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump hitting the 2020 campaign trail, attacking the press and Sweden's reaction to his false claim of a terrorist attack. (0:21 - 10:38) Then, Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) chats with Seth about the importance of bipartisan efforts and her votes on Trump's cabinet nominees, as well as her shift in stance on gun rights and the Women's March. Late Night producer Henry then goes backstage with the senator to ask her about her long political relationship with Hillary Clinton. (10:59 - 26:37). Finally, earlier this week Seth did a special bonus segment with Jordan Peele on Facebook Live. We've included the audio of that conversation here. Seth and Jordan talk about their early comedy careers in Amsterdam in a loose, free-flowing conversation never seen on TV. (26:49 - 40:24). item.title: A Closer Look: Pres. Trump's First Solo Press Conference / Interviews: Evan McMullin & Adam Scott
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at Trump's press conference full of false claims, grievances and attacks on the media. Then, former CIA officer and 2016 presidential candidate Evan McMullin talks to Seth about his concerns about the Trump administration and its ties to Russia, and the necessity of congressional oversight of the executive branch. Backstage, Late Night producer Henry asks him about the role of centrist Republicans in today's politics. Finally, Adam Scott tells Seth about his kids' obsession with every NBC show except "Parks and Recreation." Late Night producer Kevin asks him about his unique experiences working with Tom Hanks and Billy Joel. item.title: A Closer Look: Mike Flynn Resigns / Interview: John Oliver
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at national security advisor Michael Flynn's resignation after revelations that he may have secretly discussed U.S. sanctions with the Russian ambassador and then lied about it. Then, Seth and John Oliver chat about their respective approaches to Trump in the White House, and John shares his thoughts on why Trump was elected (Oprah) and a certain ex-president who needs to calm down with the vacation photos. Then, Late Night producer Henry goes backstage with John to ask him a few more questions. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Abuses His Presidential Power / Late Night Chats: Fred Armisen & Eli Janney
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at how Donald Trump uses his status as president to slam private companies and threaten lawmakers. (0:20 - 9:12) Then, Seth interviews Pulitzer Prize winning author Viet Thanh Nguyen. He shares memories of being a refugee from South Vietnam, and explains the difference between refugees and immigrants and the fears Americans have of them. Late Night producer Bee Shaffer also goes backstage with Viet to ask him a few more questions. (9:33 - 17:22) Then, the 8G Band's Fred Armisen and Eli Janney have an exclusive conversation in the podcast's newest segment, Late Night Chats. They discuss their multi-decade history playing music together, how Fred recruited the 8G Band and what goes into a day of making music for the show. (17:34 - 35:58) Photo by Lloyd Bishop/©NBC. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Lashes Out Over Travel Ban / Interviews: Anderson Cooper & Tracee Ellis Ross
item.description:
On today's episode of the Late Night Podcast, Seth takes a closer look at the Trump Administration's attempts to make up fake tragedies and openly blame the court system for future terror attacks. Then, Anderson Cooper talks to Seth about the random (and often X-rated) things he's learned while on a press tour with his famous mother, Gloria Vanderbilt, for their memoir The Rainbow Comes and Goes. He also discusses covering the White House administration under Trump's press scrutiny and whether POTUS owns a bathrobe. Finally, Black-ish star Tracee Ellis Ross reveals why her first Golden Globe win at age 44 connects her to famous mom Diana and her first-meeting fail with Moonlight's Trevante Rhodes. She goes on to explain why it's important that her series Black-ish let viewers draw their own conclusions instead of telling people what to think or believe. She goes on to explain why it's important that her series Black-ish let viewers draw their own conclusions instead of telling people what to think or believe. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump's Second Week / Amber Reads Trump's Black History Month Speech / Willie Geist
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the confusion surrounding President Trump's controversial travel ban and his bizarre calls with foreign leaders. Then, Late Night writer Amber Ruffin reads between the lines of President Trump's widely criticized Black History Month speech to explain what he really meant. Finally, Seth chats with TODAY's Willie Geist, who talks about his exciting new job on Sunday TODAY. He sticks around afterwards to talk to Late Night producer Kevin Miller about his young ambitions of working at Late Night. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump's "Muslim Ban" / Robert De Niro / Jenny Hagel & Amber Ruffin
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the second straight weekend of massive protests against President Trump - this time after he issued a ban on refugees and visitors from seven majority-Muslim countries. Then, Seth chats with film legend Robert De Niro about his new movie The Comedian, as well as his outspoken stance against Donald Trump. Finally, Late Night writers Amber Ruffin and Jenny Hagel (of Jokes Seth Can't Tell fame) share a conversation backstage. They discuss their decade-plus friendship, Amber's secret video game talent and why a certain article of clothing was symbolic for Jenny's professional success. Follow them on Twitter at twitter.com/ambermruffin and twitter.com/jennyhagel. item.title: A Closer Look: Trump Doubles Down on Lies / Interviews with Katie Couric & Matt Taibbi
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's first week in office, and his false claims about nonexistent voter fraud and concerns about his behavior. Then, Seth interviews award-winning journalist Katie Couric about press freedom under Donald Trump, as well as her new documentary, "Gender Revolution." We also go backstage with Katie to hear some more about her documentary. Finally, Seth talks to author Matt Taibbi about his new book "Insane Clown President: Dispatches from the 2016 Circus." He explains why the election of Donald Trump is "terrible and awful and hilarious all at the same time." Matt also tells Late Night producer Henry about why coming to 30 Rock is a homecoming of sorts for him. item.title: A Closer Look: President Trump's First Days / Ta-Nehisi Coates Interview
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at President Trump's first few days in office, which featured lying about crowd sizes against a backdrop of record-breaking protest occurring all over the world. Then, acclaimed writer Ta-Nehisi Coates stops by Studio 8G to talk to Seth about his remarkable cover story in The Atlantic, "My President Was Black," which documented President Obama's time in office. He gave his initial reactions to Trump's election, and also discussed the Blank Panther comic book he penned. item.title: Pod Save America Comes To Late Night / A Closer Look: Trump’s Inauguration Preparation
item.description:
On this special edition of the Late Night with Seth Meyers Podcast, Seth and Jon Favreau, Jon Lovett and Tommy Vietor, former Obama aides and current hosts of the hit podcast Pod Save America, share an extended conversation ahead of Donald Trump’s inauguration. They reflect on their respective experiences at the 2011 White House Correspondents Dinner, where Seth was the featured comedian, and ruminate on how the jokes leveled at Trump that night may or may not have influenced his decision to run for president. Also discussed are the obligations of political comedy in the Trump era, ways of reaching diverse audiences and the challenges of rebuilding political coalitions when many feel hopeless. This episode was recorded in the Late Night offices at 30 Rock on Thursday, January 19, 2017. item.title: A Closer Look: GOP Moves To Repeal Obamacare / Jake Tapper Interview
item.description:
Seth takes a closer look at the major organized effort to resist the potential consequences of Donald Trump's promise to repeal Obamacare. Then, he talks to CNN's Jake Tapper about press freedom under the Trump administration, and the unprecedented realities he and other members of the media are facing in covering the incoming president. item.title: A Closer Look: Jeff Sessions’ Confirmation Hearings / Seth Interviews Kellyanne Conway
item.description:
